did.abstract: This collection contains biographical materials, correspondence with publishers, 1958-1966, hand-corrected manuscripts of published and unpublished novels including "Stern in Nebel,"which concerns the 1933-1938 period), short stories, essays, literary criticism, children's literature, and poetry, 1947-68, and offprints of journal, magazine, and newspaper articles. A native of Vienna, Brandt taught at Colorado College from 1947 to 1966.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Thomas O. Brandt was born in 1906. A native from Vienna, Brandt moved to the United States and became a well known writer and literary scholar. Brandt taught at Colorado College from 1947 to 1966. During his time at the College, Brandt was a professor of German and chairman of the department of German and Russian. Brandt was married to Heidi Brant. Brandt died on January 9, 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains biographical materials, correspondence with publishers, 1958-1966; hand-corrected manuscripts of published and unpublished novels including "Stern in Nebel" which concerns the 1933-1938 period, short stories, essays, literary criticism, children's literature, and poetry, 1947-1968; and offprints of journal, magazine, and newspaper articles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Heidi Brandt donated all materials to the M.E. Grenander Department of Speical Collections and Archives in October 1993.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Thomas O. Brandt Papers, 1897-1968. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Brandt Papers).
